inn1.comm: full and straight, timed to mid-on
outside off, hint of swing but goes easily through to Taylor
fuller this time and crisply driven but straight to the man at mid off
again full, Mpofu searching for the swing and Porterfield comes onto the front foot and plays down the pitch
back of a length and played from the crease out into the on side

gone! short of a length, bounces outside off stump and Porterfield pushes at it and gets the edge...it flies to Taylor who should have pouched it easily but muffs the chance, but to the relief of Zimbabwe Vusi Sibanda dives behind the keeper from second slip and takes the rebound

It was an impressive opening over from Mpofu and he was rewarded with that final delivery
hint of swing first up, half an appeal but going over the top but plenty of encouragement with the new ball
and the first runs come for Ireland as Bray comes forward and pushes through point with nice timing
played into the covers, testing time for the openers
slightly fuller and Bray comes forward with bat and pad together
movement for Rainsford and the ball takes the thick inside edge and goes down to fine leg
survives it easily enough, but a decent start for Rainsford
Bray has nothing to do with this one as he raises the bat high
Mpofu probing away outside off stump, Bray again watches it go through to Taylor
slightly wide, another easy leave but some bounce on offer
fourth leave of the over, but the more dot balls sent down the more the pressure will grow. At the moment, though, Bray should be happy to see off the new ball
how long can Bray resist having a go at one of these deliveries as another one passes by? He likes to play to shots
and the over ends in familiar style, a steady maiden but it would help Zimbabwe if the batsmen had to play a few more balls
this one is wide, Morgan goes for the drive and misses...the Zimbabweans go up for a catch behind but the umpire signals wide. The bat may have clipped the ground although replays aren't conclusive
beauty from Mpofu, pitches on middle and off, seams away and Morgan does well not to get the edge
manges to get bat on this, back to the bowler
another cracker, seams away and Morgan goes fishing again
handsome straight drive from Morgan, past the right hand of mid on but not with enough timing to reach the fence
pushed into the covers
on middle and Morgan plays back to the bowler, another testing over from Rainsford and the pressure is on Ireland
more bounce to encourage the bowler and Bray watches it goes through to the keeper
too wide this time and the umpire gets to stretch his arms
much tighter this time and Bray shows good judgment as it passes over the top of off stump
that's the Bray that has made his name for Ireland, a touch of width and he frees his arms to power it through point for the first boundary...the Irish fans go wild
back to leaving mode
this one goes all the way over point as Bray lays into a short, wide offering with impressive results...the pressure just coming off Ireland here...that was some hit
Mpofu gets his line back again and Bray comes forward to cover any movement
drifting onto leg stump and neatly worked around the corner down to long leg
nicely punched into the covers and a well judged single
again, too much on leg stump and Morgan rolls the wrists and flicks it through square leg
back on off stump by Rainsford and played into the off side
back of a length, on middle, and worked to midwicket
driven to mid off
typical one-day shot from Bray as he angles it down to third man
cut powerfully through point, nice shot from Morgan who is starting to find his feet
dropped lucky this for Morgan as he flashes hard but it almost goes through hands of Chigumbura at slip who acts like it didn't really see it, four to Morgan but that was close
Mpofu tightens his line to end the over and Morgan covers up
short and wide by Rainsford, Bray latches on and carves through the covers...it looks like a certain boundary until Sean Williams backs a brilliant diving save on the cover boundary
beauty! pitches and seams away, zips past the edge of Morgan's bat
on the legs, Morgan clips in the air but wide of mid on and the ball pulls up short of the fence
fuller and on off stump, Morgan comes forward and bat and pad close together
hammered! overpitched and too wide, Morgan shows his class and crunches it through the covers with a powerful drive...there was no stopping that one
ooh! nearly the perfect reply from Rainsford as this moves away from Morgan who fishes and almost gets the edge
hits the off stump line first up, played into the covers
on the pads this time, but Bray misses out and it takes the pad out to square leg
played from the crease out to cover
well bowled! pitched on off stump and seamed away, Bray pushes forward and the ball scoots past the edge...almost the breakthrough for Zimbabwe
works this down to mid on, still a hint of movement for the seamers
back of a length and Bray tries to glide it to third man, he would have succeeded except for a brilliant save in the gully...well fielded
hits the mark first up and batsman comes forward
close! bit of movement there and Morgan plays and misses
bat on ball this time, back to the bowler
Brent not much more than medium pace, but hitting consistent areas
well, that wasn't consistent, a touch too wide and signalled as such

breakthrough! what a tame end to a promising innings, outside off stump and Morgan just limply pushes at it and sends a simple catch to Chigumbura at first slip who makes no mistake with this one...he'll be breathing a sigh of relief
very full and dug out through point, third man cleans up...fine start by Brent
played into the covers
great line from Chigumbura, O'Brien just about pulls his bat inside the line
onto the front foot and driven to cover with a crisp punch

and another goes! how the game changes. Suddenly Zimbabwe are back on top as another left-hander goes in familiar fashion, pushing away from the body with a lack of footwork and a simple catch for Taylor behind the stumps
in middle and defended back to the bowler
that swings back very late at Botha, but sails past off stump
and he shoulders arms outside the off stump. Good length, if a touch too wide
gone, surely? No! A raucous appeal from Brent to one which cut back massively into the batsman
but Brent sends this too wide, too full, and it's fairly hammered through extra cover. Fiercely struck
ooh, good line there - but a very good leave
another Dominic Cork-style appeal from Brent - another excellent delivery cutting back into the batsman who gets an inside edge
pushed out to point who shied at the stumps but it was wider than Dwayne Leverock's belt and they get a whole load of overthrows
cuts this back into the left hander who is tentatively forward, defending it off the inside edge
fuller and driven
a touch shorter this time, and driven, but straight to mid-off
a shimmy down the pitch from Bray who is then cramped for room. Not the wisest of shots, really, and he scampers back into his crease after pushing it to leg
shot: that's what Bray does best. Short and wide, Bray flays it - rather, uppercuts it - over the slips, to fine-leg's right who doesn't move and it sails for six
another huge shout as he is wrapped on the pads, but again it's turned down
clipped off his legs
and this one cuts back into him; a strangled appeal from the bowler
deliciously struck through cover, powerfully, but straight to the sweeper on the boundary
gone! Completely outfoxed there, Botha shouldering arms and the ball cut back in, clipping the top of his off stump. Dreadful misjudgement there
and he's firmly behind this one, defending it on the front foot
oh dear, that's a messy, wasteful shot from O'Brien. Wider, fuller, and O'Brien tries to flay it through cover, misses, and the bowler goes up for a huge appeal
that's much better, defending it on the back foot solidly
swinging into the batsman who clunks it back to the bowler
massively wide; the batsman hardly reaches it, almost falling over and he gets a big inside edge
a touch shorter, Bray tries to cut but he is troubled by the wicketkeeper standing up to the stumps. Desperate to free his arms, and can't
ooh hald a shout; Bray struggling with the inswinger here
that's what he wants - a bit of width - but he can only clunk it to mid-off
well bowled Brent, cramping Bray for room who can only come forward to defend it
classical! Shot of the day, driven on the up through extra cover. That was emphatic and he doesn't even bother running
left alone outside off
left alone - good line, but he's overstepped the mark
another classy drive from O'Brien but not quite as well timed as the four he hit earlier in the over, and nor as well placed. Straight to cover
calmly left alone, O'Brien watching the ball zing past into the wicketkeeper's gloves
but he just drifts this one down the legside allowing them through for a single
swing and a miss outside off. Missed it by a country mile
edged short of first slip! Reasonable ball; not a reasonable shot. A fishy, washy poke
drifting down leg, half a shout for lbw but it's just going down
nearly! Walks across his stumps, flicks it to leg - Taylor, the wicketkeeper, dives to his left and nearly gets a finger to it. Inches away
good one, on middle-and-off, defended solidly though
ooh he thought about driving that. A tempting, teasing line outside off - but he rightly chose to ignore it
a touch slower, wobbling in the air and it's nudged to leg
angling into the left hander who chops it to point
drops it short and he pulls it, aerially, over midwicket without much conviction
good ball on off stump, watchfully defended
very middling pace there, and the wrong line for once too - drifting down leg and it's easily flicked to leg

nearly! Bray was beaten there, spooning it just wide of cover - oh but cover, and I can't see who it was, swoops and shies at the stumps. Brilliant piece of fielding and Bray'd have been miles out had the fielder hit
left alone
and he tries to hit this into the ocean and misses. Poor stroke
"wait" roars Bray as he nudges this to leg
shot. Too short, Bray goes back and absolutely hammers it wide of mid-on
ooh good comeback! Fuller, and cutting back into Bray who is cramped
good bowling, good line and good pace. Bray struggles with the fuller, swinging ball - as he did here. The ball smacking into the pads
nearly! Inside-edged into his boot and very nearly crashing into his stumps
played out towards point
extra bounce there and it climbs past the outside edge, well bowled
tight lines from Mpofu, O'Brien goes back and across
off stump and played from the crease again back down the pitch
tries to turn this into the on side but the hint of movement means it takes the leading edge and pops into the off side, no danger however
stays a fraction lower than O'Brien expected but he manages to get his bat down in time

hint of width and smashed by Bray, who continues to hold the innings together, and the ball races through the covers. It is so well timed it beats the man sweeping on the fence and a welcome boundary for Ireland
works this one backward of square on the leg side
cracking ball swings past the edge but Rainsford overstepped so any edge wouldn't have counted
tucked into the leg side, rotates the strike
more width and hammered again, but picks out the man on the point fence this time so it's just the single...but Bray certainly packs a punch
full, searching for the swing, and driven up to mid off

another one goes! the problems mount for Ireland just as a recovery was being shaped by these two. O'Brien enticed into having a drive at a full one, but it swings away and takes the outside edge...another comfortable take for Taylor and Ireland are five down
punched into the covers
placed into the covers this time, scamper a single
comes forward, bat and pad together
same again from Utseya and White
tries to sweep from outside off stump but doesn't make contact
turned into the leg side, tidy start from Utseya

flashed away down to third man, should have just been a single but Mpofu makes a hash of things down at third man and it goes for a boundary...brings up Ireland's first fifty in World Cup cricket, well played
back to concentration for Bray, comes forward and defends
forward again, solid from Bray
fine drive from Bray, real power in that shot but placement too as he beats the man on the point fence
it nearly works too, as Bray doesn't quite adjust to the new line and has a flash but misses
powerfully driven on the up but straight at cover
turned into the leg side, White still yet to score
tries to sweep, half an appeal for lbw but not much going for it really as it missed the pad
all defence from White
off the mark now as he connects with a sweep out to deep square-leg
played off the back foot, Utseya fields off his own bowling
hint of turn, strangled appeal but Bray in no danger as ball goes into the covers
on off stump, played on the front foot
picks this up over deep midwicket, fielded on the fence but it brings up the 100 for Ireland and more cheers from the fans
low full toss, down to long on
on leg stump, sweeps and short fine-leg's dive can't save the runs
forward, back to the bowler
steady end to the over, another forward defence
played back to the bowler
turned round the corner onto the leg side
that's something different, tries the reverse sweep but doesn't connect...bit risky given the scoreline
driven to mid off
sweeps, takes the top edge but flies safely out to deep square-leg
drifting outside leg stump, flicked to short fine-leg
similar ball, but tucked wide of short fine-leg this time
driven firmly down to long off
pushed out to cover
fired in towards leg stump, sweeps fine but a good diving save from short fine-leg
driven up to long off, another steady over allround
onto the front foot, bat and pad together
sweeps, but straight to square leg
tries to angle this away, but misses and Taylor collects
doesn't make the sweep, takes the pad
another missed sweep, not much pace to work with here
down to long on, Bray keeps the strike
played down to long on
short, but White misses out and picks out cover
back to the bowler
flighted up and White goes down and crunches a sweep out to deep square-leg
uses his feet, driven straight back to Williams
another sweep that doesn't connect, dribbles square on the leg side for one
nicely flighted, Bray - in a fine Lehmann-esque wide-brimmed hat - blocks his bat behind the pad
swept fine
reverse-swept, brilliantly - superb shot, and that's four. Powerfully hit indeed
back onto his stumps and flicked to leg, and they take a single. Oh, they're coming back for two - that's very well run
defended on the front foot
beaten! The arm ball I think, the goes-straight-onner, and it passes by his sweep
defended on the front foot
excellent ball cutting Bray in half who edges it past the vacant slips down to third man
defended on the back foot
cracking delivery again! Cutting into the right-hander before swinging away, edged past the wicketkeeper
powerfully driven to cover who dives, athletically, saving four. Zimbabwe's fielding has been slick today
tries to launch this into the sea but can only turn it around the corner
driven to mid-on
reverse-swept, again very well played
driven to mid-on
driven in the style of Darren Lehmann through cover
clunked to cover
smacked back to the bowler, bump ball which sails over the bowler's head
oh, shot, punching this on the up but again he finds cover. And the ball reaches the fielder in a flash
bit of wobble on that one, outside off and it's defended on the back foot
slower ball, shorter too and he tries to pull it but is beaten by the lack of pace
again a slower ball but he reads it this time - and it's drifting down leg - so whips it for a single
this hurries Bray who clunks it to mid-on, but a misfield can't prevent the single
excellent ball hurrying Bray who rocks back and defends
too short, Bray works it to leg
another reverse sweep but he finds a short third man, placed precisely for that shot
pinged to mid-off
full, and again Bray can't get on top of it, just smacking it back to the bowler
flicked to midwicket but again no run there
nicely cut in front of square, but without sufficient power
too short allowing Bray to pull it powerfully, but can only find fine leg
ooh and it's an outside edge through the vacant slips - and down for four
defended on the back foot
swinging into the batsman who tries to work it to leg, misses, and that looks very tight indeed. But again the umpire turns down a strangled appeal
timed off the back foot
too short and it's easily worked off the back foot through midwicket
worked straight to midwicket
another superb reverse sweep - he really does play that very well, with great conviction, and that races for four
and again, fearlessly, he goes for it but it's cut off in the deep this time
driven uppishly to leg, and it falls just short of mid-off
outside the off stump, he tries to pull it into the stand over midwicket but is hit on the pad. Missed it comfortably
powerfully cut but Sean Williams at backward point makes an excellent, nonchalant stop
gone! The slower ball, looping up high and White completely misread it, trying to pull it over midwicket. That was taking out middle stump and at last Gould raises his finger
ooh, left alone at the last minute
too wide and it's left alone
ah, nice way to get off the mark - in fact he's timed that quite brilliantly, just working it to leg and it races for four
oh, shot. He finds the fielder at a wide long-off but it was sweetly timed for two
filthy wide, almost not making the cut-strip and Bray struggles to reach it. But cuts it hard into the covers
short, spinning into the right hander who works it to leg
neatly timed off his pads again, but the wrong line from the bowler, drifting it down leg
just a little too short this time and Bray rocks back, gives himself room and punches it past mid-off
too short, too wide, cut hard to deep extra cover
ooh, this spits up at Johnston a touch - but he plays it well, with soft hands, nudging it to leg
quicker, and it hurries Bray who is struck on the pad
shot, Bray. It was too full, right in the slot and Bray just flicked it over midwicket for four
too short, Bray tries to pull it but can't time it properly
hammered off the back foot past a despairing cover; sweeper comes in to save two
full, down the leg side but Bray rather falls over and can't time it
pushed to the on side
flicked back down the pitch to Utseya
angled into the off side, brings Bray back onto strike
slightly short and swung away through square leg
can't beat the bowler as he pushed down the pitch
goes for sweep, hits the back leg but well outside off stump and the appeal is turned down
pushed down to long on
played into the covers
worked through square leg, important Bray has as much strike as possible
sweeps in the air, but very safe and out to deep square-leg
there's a big shot, launches this out to deep midwicket, Chibhabha makes a valiant attempt to sprint in and take the catch but can't quite get there - harsh to call that a miss, it was a good stop
worked to short fine-leg
punched to cover
uses his feet and drives to long off
Utseya hits the mark straight away, played back down the pitch
punched to midwicket
finds the gap down to long on, Utseya dived but couldn't prevent the run
pitched on leg stump, comes forward
full, nicely clipped through square leg and a fumble at deep square-leg makes the second comfortable
drifts down leg side, Johnston gets a tickle on it and it races to fine leg...valuable runs
outside off stump, nearly a wide but not quite although the Irish fans thought it was
drives to drive, but without any time and takes half the bat down to long on
full outside off stump and a wonderful cover drive from Bray who moves into the 90s with one of his best boundaries

a complete mix-up! the useful stand is broken as Bray slaps a full toss into the covers, Johnston races up the pitch but Bray starts then stops. Johnston turned but couldn't get back as the throw came into Mpofu and he lobbed it into the stumps
played into the covers
off the pads into the leg side
and another goes! Bray could run out of partners here as McCallan goes for the sweep but misses, Taylor whips off the bails and the foot is on the line...he has to go
played out to point
another dot to finish, good tight stuff towards the end here from Zimbabwe
flayed through point, one hand comes off the bat
reaches for this one which is very wide, his hand comes off the bat too and pushes it out to deep point
brilliant strike, on leg stump and Bray quickly picks it up over midwicket and there's no one out there...he gets closer
very full and dug out to backward point
low full toss, swings hard at it but without timing and it goes to long on
driven firmly but straight at cover
punches down to long on, will he get them in singles?
worked into the leg side, can't get the run
nearly a mix-up! that could have been the end of a beautiful friendship. Angled to short third-man, never a single there and Bray gets back
sweeps, goes fine and manages to get a brace
no way there was going to be two that time, lobs over the keeper's head
worked into the covers, onto 99 and the nerves will be jangling for Bray...it's been a great effort
yorker, on middle, just gets down on it...pressure, pressure!
and there it is! a memorable century for Jeremy Bray as he flays this ball wide of third man for his 10th boundary and what a moment for Irish cricket
low full toss, hammered through the covers
driven hard at cover, well stopped
connects well with this, full and driven out to point to raise the 200. A fine effort after being 99 for 5 at the halfway mark
driven one-handed down to long off. Bray wants to keep the strike, but he must be feeling the effects of his time in the middle
well struck through the covers and Bray just keeps going as he gets two to long off
well placed between long on and deep midwicket, another well-run couple
more excellent running, shows the fitness of Bray as he chops it down to third man
powered down to long off
swing and miss, tries to go over the leg side

oh boy, that's a shambles! Langford-Smith goes for huge heave over the leg side and it takes the top edge high out to deep square-leg. Chigumbura tries to get under it, but slips twice and ball loops over his head for a boundary...that will be replayed throughout the World Cup. In his defence the outfield is a little damp after the rain
well placed out to deep cover
thumping through the covers, but straight to the man on the fence

it's all happening! clever thinking from Rainsford as a low full toss is swung down to long off where he gets under it before his momentum carries him towards the ropes and he quickly releases it to prevent a six
another fumble in the outfield and another couple out to deep midwicket
well struck to long on, more excellent running but Mpofu also fumbled the return
final ball wicket, as a huge swipe goes high in the air and Taylor steadies himself under the catch

inn2.comm: full and straight, timed to mid-on
bang! Well he absolutely laced that square of the wicket on the front foot. Superb drive
edged! Falls short of first slip and they somehow steal a single...
driven to mid-off without much timing
ooh very full but too wide, and swinging wider
more swing from Dave but it's neatly defended by the batsman
drifting down the left-hander's leg stump and it's worked around the corner, but straight to a short fine-leg
creamed through the covers. Too full, too wide and dispatched
that's much better from Rankin - yorker-length and Duffin digs it out with his shovel
better still from Rankin; on middle-and-off and just cutting away a touch. Nice and full too, squaring up Duffin
wide of Duffin's off-stump and left alone
half a shout - and an impressively raucous one, too - from Rankin to one which smacked Duffin on the pads, but the batsman got a thick inside edge
left alone outside off
a big leg-side drifter, swinging wider and rightly called a wide
again drifting down leg and Sibanda flicks it off his pads, wide of fine-leg who jogs to his left to field
flicked again down to fine-leg for a single
much better. On Duffin's middle stump, as it were, and it's firmly defended
and Duffin prods down on this, pushing it out into the covers
ooh and he sends this just a touch wider of Duffin who eyes a juicy boundary but instead fishes and misses
ooh and it's pushed off the back foot, probably intentionally, to where a third slip would've been and - oh dear! - third man makes a spectacular cock-up of it, and the ball nutmegs him for four
classily driven past the bowler
better line and length. The right-hander leaves this well alone, shouldering arms with a flourish
ooh and this spits up at the batsman who fends it off awkwardly, and only just wide of the man at point who makes a diving attempt to catch it. Very well bowled.
down the leg side, and that'll be another wide
this tucks Duffin up, but he nudges it into a small gap on the leg side and they sprint through for a single
delicious shot, driven powerfully back to the bowler who - all 6 foot 7 inches of him - heaves down to field
nicely angled wide of cover and they steal a single
too wide and it's left alone
a cracker! The first real snorter from an Ireland bowler, angling into the batsman before cutting away from his defensive poke
and Sibanda threatens to drive this before shouldering arms
but he drifts this down the leg-side again, allowing Sibanda to flick him to fine-leg
swinging into Duffin who, with a heavy bottom hand, clunks it straight to mid-off
crash! He laced that one but straight to cover
dropped - on middle stump before cutting away from Duffin, who followed it, edging it to O'Brien who shelled a simple chance to his left
defended on the front foot
good length from Rankin again, the ball rising from just short of a good length
and again it spits up on Duffin who plays it very well, with high, soft hands, angling it into the gully
dropped - oh dear, that was village from Eoin Morgan. A straightforward outside edge, straight to him at second slip who was never in a position to take the catch
GONE! Goddim! Third time lucky for Rankin, as Duffin edges another excellent delivery straight to O'Brien who, this time, doesn't have to move a muscle
excellent ball - Rankin-like length, just rising on the batsman who left it well alone
a half-volley which he fairly smashes but straight to Johnston at cover
good length; poor line and it's easily left alone by the batsman
Langford-Smith's finding his lines, now. A good nut on off-stump, forcing the defensive
in the corridor of uncertainty, swinging away from Sibanda who leaves alone
worked to leg
defended on the back foot
and he goes for an expansive cover drive but gets an inside edge, somehow evading his stumps and also evading O'Brien's dive behind the stumps
full, but drifting down leg - yet the batsman can't make anything of it, missing out on an easy flick down to fine leg
drifts this further down leg and, this time, it's a wide
bashed down the ground, aerially, to the bowler's left, through long off and it just bobbles over the line
better shot; lofted with power and timing, squarer this time, and Porterfield out on the extra cover boundary signals that he's saved four with a sprawling dive...
cracked off the back foot
firmly and crisply driven back to the bowler
drifting down leg but he can't connect with it
on middle stump and pushed to leg
comes forward to defend, rather pushing at it ungainly so but defends it solidly enough
this angles into Chibhabha who plays it softly to leg
filthy wide outside off
and again drifting down leg, but Chibhabha can't make anything of it
ooh and he's squared up here, the ball spooning into the covers as he tried to work it to leg
oh dear, commentators' kiss of death again. What a shot - remarkably pulled, well in front of square, with tremendous power
and again he pulls this over square leg for three
better ball, fuller and straighter and defended
and he tries to work this around the corner, but misses out
good end to the over, finding one to rise on the batsman who nevertheless plays it neatly off the back foot
good line, takes the thick outside edge and third man is too square to prevent the boundary. Unlucky for Langford-Smith, it was a nice piece of bowling, although it was played well with soft hands
that, however, was ugly as he tried to heave across the line and the ball crashes into the pads. No need for that
well driven but there's a man at a straight, short cover who dives and fields
not much footwork, Sibanda just frees his arms and slashes this down to third man
ooh, close! nice swing and Chibhabha pushed at it and nearly got the edge
firmly clipped to mid on who prevents any runs
close! tries to glide to third man and misses, keeper is standing up and collects neatly
too short and at military medium that is easily pulled over midwicket although the man on the boundary keeps it to two
chopped down to third man
full and driven to square cover
this one ducks into the right-hander, Botha rolled his fingers across that to take some of the pace off it
played out to point, tidy start from Botha
too wide from Langford-Smith and an easy call for the umpire
tighter line and Sibanda judges well and leaves it go
well played, the ball was just about on middle but Sibanda clips it cleanly through square leg and it beats long leg into the fence
short and wide but slapped straight to point, he missed out there
drifting onto the pads, rolls down the leg side and O'Brien makes a good diving save
tries to cut this, but plays underneath the ball as it doesn't quite bounce
handsomely driven but straight to mid off
played down to third man
driven to mid off, feels he missed a scoring chance there
pushed down to third man
oversteps and another nudge to third man
guess what, another single to third man, smart batting by these two
played into the covers
full pitches, hint of inswing and driven back to the bowler
another run down through the slips cordon to third man
tight line on off stump, defended into the covers
nice drive, but picks out the man in the cover ring
up in the block hole, well dug out
pushed into the gully area, good pressure on Chibhabha who is struggling here
short, goes for the pull but gets nowhere near it
full toss and Sibanda misses out by finding cover with his drive
cut away but brilliantly fielded by White in the gully to prevent any runs
punched into the covers, the vocal Niall O'Brien screams "who's on it"...someone is
takes the pads into the on side
Botha keeps a tight line and all Sibanda can do is push to point
a fine over ends with another on-target delivery
Chibhabha is completely out of touch here as he misses another pull, this one flies over the stumps
lets this go through to O'Brien, 50 minutes in the middle now for just two runs
tries to find the empty slips cordon to third man but plays to gully
finds the gap this time - and with power - as he latches onto a ball slightly short and wide, sending it through the gap between point and cover
close! delivery holds its line and Chibhabha nearly pushes at it
back and across and defended out to point
chopped to backward point and well fielded
back to the bowler
driven into the covers but can't find the gap
right on the stumps and Sibanda comes forward
pushed into the covers, fielder was a little slow and despite a dive can't prevent the single
very full and dug out to cover
tries to run this to third man but doesn't connect, probably better using the full face
goes for the pull, gets on it a little early and plays it to the left of mid on...but it takes him to his half-century. A compact innings
almost a mix-up as they scamper a single to mid-on...Sibanda nearly collides with Johnston but makes his ground as the shy misses

wow, this is a close call. It's played down to third man and Chibhabha comes back for the second but it's a bullet throw from the boundary...he dives as O'Brien takes the bails off and the replays show it's very tight...he's given the benefit of the doubt
angled out to point as Chibhabha collects his thoughts
driven but there's a tight ring field in the covers and he can't find the gap
perfect straight drive, foot to the pitch and plays through the line and the ball races to the long off fence...this is a fine innings from Sibanda
watchfully played into the covers
good ball, holds its line outside off stump and nearly takes the edge
comes forward, looks for the single but it's not there as point fields
oversteps...Ireland can't afford to give away extras
very full, swings into the pads and is clipped through the leg side
well bowled, Chibhabha plays down the wrong line and that was mighty close to taking the stumps
and he comes down the pitch, a shimmy, but decides against lofting it, instead whipping the ball to mid-on
defended on the front foot
cutting back into the right-hander who defends
straighter, too straight, and it's turned around the corner
goddim! It was short and wide, deserved to be hit - but he could only loft it to mid off who took a simple catch
on off stump, cutting back into him and he stands tall to defend
good start, just outside off and he comes forward to defend
a touch straighter which he turns to leg
too short allowing Williams to cut
close! Very, very close. Williams was cramped for room and he cut it inches from his off stump, nutmegging the wicketkeeper for four
and he's gone for an almighty heave - this is up in the air, round comes the fielder but it drops short
played off the back foot. Again Williams gives himself masses of room
shot! He has absolutely hammered it, on the up, square of the wicket for four. Bang
on leg stump and worked behind square for a couple
cracking ball which moves away from Williams's tentative forward defence
on off stump - just shaping back into the left-hander, too, who comes forward to block it out
again it's defended on the front foot
pulled with immense power, the ball fairly zinging off the bat, but he can't evade the man at deep square leg
defended on the front foot
gone! And there ends a fairly incomprehensible innings from Williams who skipped down the pitch, trying to loft it over mid-on but found Rankin who, at 6 foot 7, was never going to drop that
worked straight to a short midwicket
straight, turned just behind square and they scamper a single - no they don't! Here comes the throw from Kevin O'Brien to McCallan but he can't collect it. My word - that was dreadful running
solidly defended
pushed to midwicket
good ball - good length, just forcing the batsman back onto his stumps who defends
beaten! Lovely ball; the batsman came forward but very tentatively, just pushing at it without any conviction
straighter and a touch shorter, worked to leg
again cramped for room; again he finds midwicket
too wide and left alone. Not called a wide though...
defended firmly - and there's a maiden
two steps down the pitch and he hammers it, along the ground, to mid-off
oh, shot. On-driven, slightly uppishly but perfectly safe - and with tremendous power
cleverly late-cut there - deftly played
pushed to cover and they scamper a single
beaten outside off
tossed higher; delivered slower, but the batsman copes and nudges it fine
and he starts with an arm ball, beating the forward poke
blocked out on the front foot
far too short and it's cracked off the back foot for a single. Actually, they run well and grab two
too full, worked to midwicket
elegantly driven to cover for a single
fabulous shot. It was too wide, too full from White but crisply and authoritatively driven by Matsikenyeri along the ground
shimmies down the pitch and clunks it to long off for a single
good length, dragging the batsman forward who defends
a touch shorter this time; back goes the batsman to block it out
huge! A real heave-ho there, stepping back and smiting it over long-on for six
full, almost under his nose, and it's well driven but White does well to prevent a run at backward point
late-cut but again to backward point
gone! Played off the back foot and neatly timed, but he's too far back in his crease and treads on his stumps!
beaten! The arm-ball...very well bowled, passing by an indecisive forward poke
good line just outside off, forcing the defensive
defended solidly
just short of a length and again the batsman refuses to take a risk, just defending it
pushed out to cover and there's a wicket maiden
superbly fielded by Morgan as the batsman smacked it powerfully and he dived from cover to prevent a run
hit to the bowler's right
elegantly flicked off his pads to deep square leg and they pick up two
worked off his pads behind square and they scamper, very well, for two. Super scampering there
good line, on off stump, and defended
great catch! A shimmy down the pitch, timing it to Bray's left who runs in from mid-on, and takes a fine, diving catch
hits the deck hard first up and played to the on side
on the back foot, pushed out to point
keeps a tight line and played to cover
cut away to third man
outside off stump, no shot from Taylor...that probably won't last for long
shoulders arms, showing plenty of restraint so far
flighted up and driven back down the pitch, well fielded by McCallan in his follow through
pushed down to long on
on the front foot, bat and pad together
that's nerves...worked into the leg side and Taylor sets off but Matsikenyeri is having non of it and sends him right back
inside edge into the pad, half an appeal
there's the big shot...comes down the track and just about gets to the pitch, swings through the line and sends it high over mid off to relieve some of the pressure
well placed cut shot, rolled his wrists well to combat the extra bounce from Rankin and sent it racing to the point fence
oooh, extra bounce again and this time the ball flies over the attempted cut shot
off the back foot out to point, Rankin steaming in here and working up decent pace...around the 81mph (130kph) mark
just drifting onto the legs and neatly picked off through midwicket, some confusion between fielders allows them back for three
played from the crease, back to the bowler
played with soft hands just backward of point and a well taken single brings the final drinks break
tucked into the leg side
comes forward but can't find the gap on the leg side
however, this time he finds the off side gap and with no one on the off side boundary that's a valuable boundary...too short from McCallan and well put away
played back to the bowler, who fumbles in his follow through
played with a very straight back down to long on
worked past square leg but it's just a single...and Matsikenyeri slips at the non-striker's end anyway
and starts with a very wide wide...but only the ninth extra of the innings
finds his line this time, played from the crease
cut away hard into the ground, bounces up and is well gathered by point for a crowd catch
very well run, just dropped onto the on side and Langford-Smith can't do anything in his follow through to stop the single
full, on middle and driven back to the bowler
played on the move by Taylor into the covers
played to the right of mid on and well judged single keeps the scoreboard moving
pushed into the covers
driven on the up straight back up the pitch
similar shot and carries halfway back to the bowler...Taylor needs to be careful about the lack of pace here and not play too early
tight stuff from Botha as this goes to cover...four dot balls of pressure
not giving anything away and Taylor can't find the gap for singles
and Botha delivers with another straight ball...an excellent maiden
well bowled, nips back into Matsikenyeri and hits the bat and pad together...strangled shout except from O'Brien who shouts a full appeal
clean strike, goes straight down the ground past mid on...a useful boundary for Zimbabwe
defended this time as Langford-Smith pitches up
clipped through square leg...plenty off this over for Zimbabwe
nicely driven but straight to mid on
pushed into the covers
top shot! handsome drive through the covers, wasn't a half volley but hit it on the up and picked the gap with perfection, no chance for long off to get around
cramped for room this time as he chops out to point
slower ball, Matsikenyeri picks it and defends
comfortable driven out to deep cover, he has the earlier boundary and is quite happy to knock it around
punched down to long on, just the one but another useful over for Zimbabwe
good line from the captain and Taylor comes forward
driven down to mid off, who is on the edge of circle but still stops the single
slightly fuller, cover comes in quickly to stop the run
huge inswinger from Johnston but it started well wide and Taylor watches it go past
full and driven firmly back to Johnston who fields sharply in his follow through, good over but Taylor doesn't need to panic
bat and pad together, maiden from Johnston and a fine return for the captain
guided out to deep point
and another dot, played out to cover...pressure can do funny things
lucky! Taylor flashes at this and it shoots past the keeper who is stood up and through the vacant first slip area and down to third man
back to the bowler
full toss and Taylor manages to punch it down to long on
nips back into Matsikenyeri who blocks into the covers
lovely drive from Taylor, just punching it effortlessly past the bowler for four
wide of the off stump and Taylor dabs it down to third man. Neatly, cleverly played
too wide again; chopped behind square
but a better delivery this  time, fuller and straighter - defended on the front foot
punched off the back foot to cover
very well played off the back foot, turning it to leg with soft hands. Just a single, though they do think about the second
on middle-and-off, pushed to mid-on
lands this on leg stump, swept down to fine leg who sends in a good throw - the batsman's diving to make his ground, and they're calling for the replay
down the pitch and it's lofted, here we go - this'll be taken at long-on by Bray. Dropped! Oh dear - and it goes for four. And double oh-dear, there's his fifty
pushed into the covers
miles too short allowing him to go back and nudge it for a single to leg
ooh again, this is lofted aerially over midwicket - bit wishy washy, that
pushed to leg and they steal more runs
inside edge onto his pads and they skip through
again down the leg side; again it's whipped off his pads
on off stump and he just milks it down the ground for the easiest of singles
better, tighter line this time and it's defended
superb shot, just skipping down the pitch and fairly smacking it to the bowler's right. There's no one back there and it races for four
smacked to the bowler's right who gets a finger on it, flicking it back onto the non-striker's stumps and they call for the replay as Taylor hasn't quite got his bat back. And that's out
firmly defended on the front foot
down the leg side - a hopeless delivery, frankly, and he gets a thin nick on it, sending it down to fine leg for four more
good length there from Johnston, forcing the batsman back who then defends
again, a good length which is defended on the front foot this time
gone! No. Everyone in the ground bar the bowler appealed - how utterly bizarre. The batsman came forward, appeared to get an edge but his bat hit the pad
defended solidly this time
swing and a miss!
fended to point - or rather, just short of point - who swoops, fires in a throw but it's wide of the stumps
on leg stump, worked to mid-on
again drifting down leg but he misses out, the ball hitting his pad
too full to be cutting, but he still cuts it...chopping it down by his feet
"bowling mate, bowling" is the cry from O'Brien as this one is hit back to the bowler
on leg, worked to mid-on
ooh excellent ball to finish the over, on off stump and it kept rather low
outside off, punched to cover
smacked straight to point
down the leg side, worked to midwicket and they scamper through - but another fumble in the field, from O'Brien. Had he picked that up cleanly, the batsman was miles out
ah, well played; just dropped this one dead into the off side and ran a single
well bowled! Excellent yorker, though it was well dug out
clonked back to the bowler - good, tight over that
good line, good length and it's blocked out to cover
slower ball worked into the packed off side
gone! Excellent slower ball, bang on middle stump, completely foxing the batsman
full, straight, hit back to Botha
inside edge, a desperate scrambling single
another slower ball but not on target this time; defended.
GONE! A full toss, slapped straight to cover! A dreadful shot; Ireland are absolutely ecstatic, never mind the fans in the stands
well bowled! Slower, and Mpofu just dabbed it gently to mid-on
driven back to the bowler - the batsman wants a run! How? Scampers back into his crease
inside edge! My word that was close
hammered down the ground - no! Brilliant stop from the bowler's right foot
GONE! Smacked to mid-on, they run a single - but Matsikenyeri stays at the non-striker's end and mid-on's throw hits the stumps
full toss, hammered through cover and long off has a chase to his left...and does well, saving four
too short, square cut powerfully into the deep
full toss, spooned to midwicket - but no! Dropped? The man came in and appeared to just stop in his tracks, the ball dropping short!
driven past cover - and he gets the single! This gets Matsikenyeri back on strike - not a good ball from White. Not a good over.

well what a mad ball. Short, wide, cut just behind backward point who made a brilliant attempt to catch it. They go for a single, in comes the throw - but the batsman appears to run in front of his stumps...and he's home safe! My word this is madness
drives, misses and it's a tie! What a match; what an incredible last 10 overs. Only the third tie in World Cup history - all three have involved an African nation - and Ireland jump in delight
